symptoms.name: Papulo-nodule
symptoms.pattern: At inoculation site, may ulcerate or spread along lymphatics

symptoms.name: Multiple nodules
symptoms.pattern: May appear proximally along lymphatics (lymphocutaneous sporotrichosis)

symptoms.name: Systemic symptoms
symptoms.severity: Variable, more common in immunocompromised individuals
symptoms.pattern: May involve multiple visceral organs, particularly the central nervous system

physical_findings: Indurated, progressively enlarging papulo-nodule at inoculation site
Heterogeneous morphology of lesions (nodules, plaques, noduloulcerative, ulcerative, nodulocystic or warty lesions)
risk_factors: Traumatic inoculation of pathogen (thorns, hay, splinters, etc.)
Exposure to soil, decaying wood, hay, sphagnum moss
Zoonotic transmission (cat scratches, bites from other animals)

required: Isolation of Sporothrix spp. from clinical specimens
